author: Sara Schaefer Muñoz
title: Canada’s Immigration System Leaves Some Employers Wanting
text:
Calgary-area farmer Ray Price has seen a steady increase in demand from Asia for his pork products in recent years but says he can’t find enough workers to expand his business.
With an aging local workforce and Canada’s restrictions on lower-skilled immigrants, “we are chronically short on people,” he said. “Calgary has professionals, engineers and people like that, but what we need are people who want to learn meat processing.”
